article:
In engineering a 'process' is a set of interrelated tasks that, together,
transform inputs into outputs. ANSI/EIA-632-1998 Processes for Engineering a
System, Appendix A, p66 These tasks may be carried out by people, nature,
or machines using resources; so an engineering process must be considered in the
context of the agents carrying out the tasks, and the resource attributes
involved. Gilb, p392 Systems Engineering normative documents and those
related to Maturity Models are typically based on processes. For example, System
Engineering processes of the EIA-632 and processes involved in the Capability
Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) institutionalization and improvement approach.
Constraints imposed on the tasks and resources required to implement them are
essential for executing the tasks mentioned.
